Added a 'domainname' template tag.

Also, something is horribly buggy with either restructuredText, or
admindocs' parsing of it. The following docstring:

    """
    Return the domain name of the given URL. For example::

        {{ 'http://example.org/stuff'|domainname }}

    would display ``example.org``.
    """

Raises the error "Literal block expected; none found." on line 2
of the docstring (the same error is also raised throughout crispy-forms'
own docs). No amount of fiddling with things seems to fix it, except for
changing the docstring to the following:

    """
    Return the domain name of the given URL.

    For example::

        {{ 'http://example.org/stuff'|domainname }}

    would display ``example.org``.
    """

Made 'hive_member_since' an optional field.

This will allow us to distinguish between organizations that are actually
Hive members, and organizations that are "friends of Hive", e.g. partners.

Also changed the language in various places to not refer to 'hive member
organization' unless absolutely necessary: when possible, we'll use the
term 'hive organization' instead, to include both organizations that are
partners and members.

Merge pull request #27 from toolness/multi-site

Support multiple hive cities in one Django installation
added docs for multi-city directories to readme.
get rid of 'site' as optional arg, was only useful for testing.
use explicit_city_, implicit_city_ as view name prefixes.
reduced DRY for single/multi-site view name prefixes.
added help text for City.site.
add a City-aware custom admin change form template for Site.
added a test to ensure multi-city site root lists cities, not orgs.
added tests for the city_scoped decorator.
always force SITE_ID=1 by default when running test suite.

Site's city (or lack thereof) can now be changed on-the-fly.

directory.urls no longer looks at the site object to determine
what URL paths are valid; instead, it registers everything, and
individual routes determine at time of access whether to 404 or not.

We also clear the Site cache whenever City objects are modified so that
such changes take place instantaneously. This avoids lots of potential
confusion.
replace multi_city context processor w/ city.should_be_mentioned.
got rid of settings.MULTI_CITY; infer it from db.

Add MULTI_CITY setting, city_url template tag, city_reverse().

This is a slight improvement over the last commit, which introduces the
concept of a "city URL", that is, any URL whose view name begins with
"city_". On multi-city configurations, a city URL will begin with the
slug of a city, e.g. `/nyc/`, while on non multi-city installs they
will be unprefixed. The accompanying template tag and URL resolver
take care of figuring out how the site is configured and providing the
proper URL to the caller.
fix broken test

Added city-scoped searches at `/<city-slug>/`.

This is kind of a weird commit that leaves several things in flux.

I'm trying to see if I can make this project something that can be
deployed *either* as a city-specific Hive directory *or* an umbrella site
that houses the directories of many hives, depending on whether or not
the current site (identified by settings.SITE_ID) is associated with a
City model or not.

Currently, a site is potentially both of these things at once, which
is definitely odd.

One of the things I don't like about this commit is that it removes the
use of reverse urls for /find.json and /search. Right now it looks like
this might need to be fixed at least partly through the use of a custom
template tag.
changed chicago.json to have a city slug, and removed its site model.
Merge branch 'multi-site' of github.com:toolness/hive-django into multi-site

Added a 'slug' field to city.

I also discovered that using call_command() to import fixtures in a
migration, as the South docs suggest, doesn't work when the model
loading the fixtures changes, since it's using the latest version of
the model rather than South's serialized orm object. So I had to
create the fixture in code instead, which is honestly more readable
anyways.
On second thought, don't require a city to be associated w/ a site.
added directory/fixtures/chicago.json.

pressing enter. Perhaps it works on mobile devices, though?

The typeahead autocomplete only completes characters in an organization's
name and a person's full name. Now a final result called 'Search the
website for "<your query>"' is on there as well, and it links to a
search results page that searches the database more
thoroughly--specifically,through organization mission, user bio and
title.
